content: *this super basic raglan sweater is perfect for beginners a simple top-down raglan pattern is the best way to learn how to knit your very own sweater with minimal details and no waist shaping this sweater is perfect for anyone knit one for yourself your child or a friend * **note ** if only two numbers appear the number inside of parenthesis # is instruction for the child sizes while the number inside of brackets # is instruction for adult sizes **sizes ** 1-2y 2-4y 4-6y 6-8y 8-10y 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 to fit chest sizes 20 22 24 26 28 32 35 38 41 44 47 50 intended to be worn with 3-4 5 5-8 of positive ease finished chest size 23 25 25 25 27 29 31 25 39 42 45 49 52 54 58 **yarn ** echoview fiber mill - recycled yarn collective 90% merino 10% recycled materials 100g/140yds 2 2 3 4 4 5 5 6 6 7 7 8 skeins mc & echoview fiber mill botanically dyed merino yarn mini 100% merino 25g/35yds 50g/70yds for cc **materials ** us 10 circular needle 32 40 or longer or whatever size needle is needed to achieve gauge us 8 circular needle 32 40 or longer or two sizes smaller than needle used to achieve gauge stitch markers *smaller circulars and dpns are optional for working neck sleeves and cuffs * stitch holders or scrap yarn of a similar weight **gauge ** 12sts x 18 row = 4 with us 10 needle over stockinette stitch worked in the round **special techniques ** knitting in the round
